title: Seriously, Atma's
body:
I'm sure chances are this is probably beating a dead horse, but I'm also certain there is a lot of people with me that are feeling a colossal gap in the game where this item is missing.

Honestly since the map rework and item removal top and jungle have been a lot less.. fun, which I hate to admit since they are albeit greatly prettier with the rework and used to be my favourite roles. Now I tend to occupy myself with playing support sona and doing obscene ~~damage ~~ healing even after all her nerfs rework/post-rework. (Seriously she's been nerfed like four times in a row plz stahp)

Jungle might be less fun to me personally since the increased difficulty change, not a gripe mind you but an observance since jungle's presence tended to outweigh other roles and item changes when in a position where you're used to carrying more than one person's worth of weight.

On top or jungle I loved building mallatma's vi/voliburr, these two I see the most stark change by far, I built it frequently as the application was amazing, people often griped about mallet/atma's because of gold efficiency, but tbh getting 2 aa's for your 1 with the combo outweighs what was all too often unaccounted for.

Perhaps the effectiveness of that is what spurred the removal?

Anywho

tl:dr item synergy with items like this FEELS nice, and works nice, and it sucks to see it gone.

I miss Atma's Sion. It wasn't particularly good or impressive, but the potential for infinite AD (and Health->AD in general) filled a special atrium in my heart.

It was problematic when it was actually good and doing it's job. So then it was nerfed to a point where noone would want to use it EVER. So with that, instead of leaving a dead/problematic item in the game they removed it.
I miss atma's. Not because I built it, but because the unique combination of stats and passives could be something really cool if tuned properly.

There were 2 problems with Atma

1) **His efficiency relied on building a stat that the item on itself did not offer.**
Atma to be slot efficient needed that building health was an efficient strategy, and when fratmogs combo was becoming too strong, riot hit hard health itemization, and then health itemization got nerfed more and more and BoTrK was introduced so that building enough health to make Atma viable was not considered convenient anymore for players (the breakeven point was at 4000 health in terms of slot efficiency, and really few champs could build it safely when Atma was removed

2) **Crit chance was a dysfunctional stat with the rest of the itemization** 
A guy that would have needed to built that 4000 health to make Atma viable, is not likely to be a champ that builds further items for damage and crit chance. As a matter of fact, only few bruisers could think about building it ({{champion:86}}  and {{champion:41}}  being among these few notable exceptions)

I think that an Atma like item could return some day, but not with Atma stats/ passive functionality. Probably the only offensive stat that could be used by this future "Atma item" could be **attack speed** in substitution of AD and crit, and it should be studied how to tie the acquisition of that stat to the health stacking (to avoid this item becoming bruisers's favourite), but without having the downsides that made previous Atma unviable

And the true problem is that AD doesn't necessarily benefit tanks, barring few exceptions. Tanks should get an item like Ama, and the item should imho give armor-AS, as often they have abilities that work in synergy with AS.

Something like 45 armor, gaining attack speed equal to 1,5% for every 1000 missing HP (capped at 60%). Then, if the item seems still too weak, you can throw it some extra stat like MS (for example 5% MS) or CDR or some kind of other non damage stat

Atma was also a very gold efficient item, people may forget that. It may be very niche, but it was because games rarely get to the point tanks get to their 5-6 items like atma. Or that they play a champion that just isn't a tank.


If you take into account all of the statistics on Atma's Impaler, you needed 1083 health to make the item gold efficient.

If you take into account only the attack damage from Atma's Impaler, you needed 3833 / 4381/ 4452 health to gain the same attack damage as if you had spent the gold on Long Swords / Pickaxes / B. F. Swords instead.

So beyong 4452hp this item was better than BF sword.
